Overview Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(2) Overview

  • Community Support

Healthy API programs rely on a strong support community.



Community Support

Community Support Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(4) Community Support



Community Support Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(5) Community Support

  • Online forums (e.g. listserv)
  • Group Chat (e.g. Slack)
  • One-on-one coaching (by appointment)

A mature API development capability involves community support for the APIs, such as forums or chat rooms where developers can ask questions and get support.



Community Support Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(6) Community Support – Online Forums

  • Good for "async" interactions
  • Good for historical context
  • Relatively low barrier of entry


Community Support Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(7) Community Support – Group Chat

  • Good for "real-time" interactions
  • Good for sharing knowledge
  • Several open-source options (e.g. Slack)


Community Support Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(8) Community Support – One-on-One Coaching

  • Good for solving immediate problems
  • Good for sharing expertise
  • However, can be hard to scale


Community Support Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(9) Community Support – Summary

  • Online forums (e.g. listserv)
    • Good for async interactions
  • Group Chat (e.g. Slack)
    • Good for real-time interactions
  • One-on-one coaching (by appointment)
    • Good for direct sharing of expertise

A mature API development capability involves community support for the APIs, such as forums or chat rooms where developers can ask questions and get support.

Developer Relations Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(11) Developer Relations



Developer Relations Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(12) Developer Relations – Overview

  • What is it?
  • The Basics
  • Additional Tasks
  • Measures of Success

All successful API platform have a mix of in-person and online activities to help promote the team’s API and support API consumers.



Developer Relations Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(13) Developer Relations – What is it?

  • Every API has a designated DevRel member
  • DevRel contact details are on the API landing page
  • DevRel assists in onboarding API consumers
  • DevRel handles API user support queries as needed

A mindset of getting developers to adopt a platform and making them successful with their initiatives.

What is Developer Relations and What are Common Roles?, Moesif [https://www.moesif.com/blog/developer-relations/definition/What-is-Developer-Relations-and-What-are-Common-Roles/]



Developer Relations Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(14) Developer Relations – The Basics

  • "First Contact" for the API
  • Responsible for outreach to target consumers
  • General API promotion (e.g. show features, possible uses)
  • Convert consumer feedback to producer action items

DevRels are the "face" of the API



Developer Relations Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(15) Developer Relations – Additional Tasks

  • Help API consumers solve problems w/ the API
  • Help API producers improve documentation and relate materials
  • Create and share training content (articles, videos, etc.)
  • Collaborate with other DevRels to improve the program

DevRels are a bridge between producers and consumers



Developer Relations Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(16) Developer Relations – Measures of Success

  • Reduce time between reporting and resolving problems for API Consumers
  • Less need for one-on-one interactions, more reliance on peer-to-peer support
  • Shorter time between consumer feedback and product feature in production


Developer Relations Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(17) Developer Relations – Summary

  • What is it?
    • Helping developers solve their problems with your API
  • The Basics
    • DevRels are the "face" of the API
  • Additional Tasks
    • DevRels are a bridge between producers and consumers
  • Measures of Success
    • Reduce time/cost needed to improve API consumer success

API Onboarding Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(19) API Onboarding



API Onboarding Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(20) API Onboarding

  • Onboarding Goals
  • API Self-Service: Basics
  • API Self-Service: Advanced


API Onboarding Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(21) API Onboarding : Goals

  • Reduce the need for repeated interactions at the start
  • Provide a "quick win" to potential API consumers
  • Present a smooth adoption path for your API


API Onboarding Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(22) API Onboarding : Basics

  • API Overview
    • API type [REST, GraphQL, etc.], use-case examples, limits [transactions, security, etc.]
  • Authentication
    • Auth methods supported, token/expiration details, refresh methods, authorization details, etc.
  • Workflow Examples
    • Common workflow patterns, most common actions/methods, parameter bodies, etc.
  • Code Samples
    • Working small snippets through to fully-functional apps that use the API
  • Reference Documentation
    • HTTP methods, URLs, parameters/bodies, response bodies, headers, errors/status codes, etc.

API Portals should be able to answer all your API consumer's initial questions



API Onboarding Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(23) API Onboarding : Advanced

  • Changelog and/or update reports
  • Product Roadmap and/or planned upgrades
  • Comprehensive vocabulary document (names for data points and action elements)
  • Dedicated live chat and/or email forums for support (see above)
  • Keyword search across APIs
  • Written case studies
  • "Getting Started" guides
  • Uptime tracking

NOTE: focus on the basics first. Once those are stable, move on to advanced items.



API Onboarding Mike Amundsen: Product and Platform Marketing

(24) API Onboarding – Summary

  • Onboarding Goals
    • Present a smooth adoption path for your API
  • API Self-Service: Basics
    • Answer your API consumer's initial questions
  • API Self-Service: Advanced
    • Changelogs, roadmaps, case studies, and uptime tracking

Work closely with designated DevRels when establishing smooth API onboarding
